name: Building and civil engineering
description: Within Architecture and construction, Building is the study of the science, technology, and techniques of assembling, erecting, and maintaining various structures. Civil engineering is the study of planning, designing, testing, and directing the construction of large-scale buildings and infrastructure.

name: Bricklaying
description: The trade of laying bricks and other masonry units to construct walls, foundations, and other structures, a key skill in Building and civil engineering.

name: Bridge construction
description: The specialized area of civil engineering focused on the design and construction of bridges.

name: Building construction
description: The general process of adding structures to real property, a core activity in Building and civil engineering.

name: Building engineering
description: The application of engineering principles and technology to building design and construction, part of Building and civil engineering.

name: Building technology
description: The study of materials, methods, and systems used in building construction, within Building and civil engineering.

name: Carpentry and joinery (building)
description: Skilled trades involving cutting, shaping, and installing wood components in building construction, such as framing, roofing, and finishing, as part of Building and civil engineering.

name: Civil engineering
description: A professional engineering discipline that deals with the design, construction, and maintenance of the physical and naturally built environment, including public works such as roads, bridges, canals, dams, airports, sewerage systems, pipelines, structural components of buildings, and railways, central to Building and civil engineering.

name: Construction equipment
description: The study and operation of heavy machinery and equipment used in construction projects, relevant to Building and civil engineering.

name: Constructional metalwork (building)
description: The fabrication and erection of metal structures and components in building construction, a specialized trade in Building and civil engineering.

name: Dock and harbour engineering
description: A branch of civil engineering focused on the design, construction, and maintenance of docks, harbours, and other coastal structures.

name: Floor and wall tiling
description: The trade of installing tiles on floors and walls, a finishing skill in Building and civil engineering.

name: Floor covering
description: The installation of various types of flooring materials, such as carpet, vinyl, or wood, within Building and civil engineering.

name: House building
description: The specific process of constructing residential houses, a segment of Building and civil engineering.

name: Industrial abseiling (commercial)
description: The use of rope access techniques for construction, maintenance, and inspection work on high or difficult-to-reach structures, a specialized skill in Building and civil engineering.

name: Masonry and tile setting
description: Trades involving the construction with stone, brick, or concrete blocks (masonry) and the installation of tiles, key skills in Building and civil engineering.

name: Painting and wall covering
description: The trades of applying paint, wallpaper, and other finishes to interior and exterior surfaces in building construction, part of Building and civil engineering.

name: Plastering
description: The trade of applying plaster or stucco to walls and ceilings to create smooth or textured surfaces, a finishing skill in Building and civil engineering.

name: Plumbing and pipefitting
description: Trades involving the installation and maintenance of water supply, drainage, and gas systems in buildings, essential to Building and civil engineering.

name: Road building
description: The design, construction, and maintenance of roads and highways, a major area of Building and civil engineering.

name: Water engineering and technology
description: Focuses on the engineering and technological aspects of water supply, treatment, and management systems, a specialized field within Building and civil engineering.

name: Water supply and sewerage engineering
description: The design and construction of systems for providing clean water and managing wastewater, a critical part of Building and civil engineering.

name: Ventilation
description: The design and installation of systems for providing fresh air and controlling air quality in buildings, within Building and civil engineering.
